Posts.Content: zendagirl wrote: After almost 1.5 years on the drug combo 5FU, Methotrexate & Cytoxan I have a couple of new liver tumors and my cancer markers have been increasing.  Nothing really drastic in terms of size or numbers, but changes none the less.  For chemo we are looking at starting Gemzar next. My sisters have been looking at this Y90 Internal Radiation which can be used on metastatic breast cancer to the liver.  We are looking to see if I would even be a candidate.  Not a cure, but may give me more time. Has anyone out here ever done the Y90 treatment?  If so, can you share your experience with that?  If you have had Gemzar how did it affect you? I know everyone's response to chemo etc...is different, but it's still nice to get a picture from others. Thanks! Dx 4/2005, IDC, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, 13/23 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 4/14/2005 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 7/31/2005 Femara (letrozole) Surgery 8/24/2005 Mastectomy: Left, Right Radiation Therapy 10/2/2005 Dx 11/2009, IDC, Stage IV, Grade 3, ER+/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 3/14/2011 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel) Targeted Therapy 3/29/2011 Avastin (bevacizumab) Chemotherapy 5/13/2012 Doxil (doxorubicin) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Y90 Internal Radiation And/Or Gemzar zendagirl NYCchutzpah
Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: May 18, 2012 01:09PM zendagirl wrote: I understand how you feel. I am now 38, was originally diagnosed at 31 with a 3 year old and 6 month old. I was diagnosed stage IV in 2009. Now, as you are, fighting for all the time we can get. My hair comes and goes right now. I'm at that very short point, and those who may not know me assume I've fought the fight and I'm doing well. Ummmm, no I'm not doing OK. It is frustrating when those considerably older than us don't understand what we're facing.
Posts.Title: No, you don't understand... Stormynyte Reneepals
